   20: -module(init_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   24: -feature(maybe_expr, enable).
   25: 
   26: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   27: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   28: 
   29: -export([get_arguments/1, get_argument/1, boot_var/1, restart/1,
   30: 	 many_restarts/0, many_restarts/1, restart_with_mode/1,
   31: 	 get_plain_arguments/1,
   32: 	 reboot/1, stop_status/1, stop/1, get_status/1, script_id/1,
   33:          dot_erlang/1, unknown_module/1, dash_S/1, dash_extra/1,
   34:          dash_run/1, dash_s/1,
   35: 	 find_system_processes/0
   36:          ]).
   37: -export([boot1/1, boot2/1]).
   38: -export([test_dash_S/1, test_dash_s/1, test_dash_extra/0,
   39:          test_dash_run/0, test_dash_run/1]).
   40: 
   41: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   42: 
   43: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   44: %% Test suite for init. (Most code is run during system start/stop.
   45: %% Should be started in a CC view with:
   46: %% erl -sname master -rsh ctrsh
   47: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   48: suite() ->
   49:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   50:      {timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
   51: 
   52: all() -> 
   53:     [get_arguments, get_argument, boot_var,
   54:      many_restarts, restart_with_mode,
   55:      get_plain_arguments, restart, stop_status, get_status, script_id,
   56:      dot_erlang, unknown_module, {group, boot},
   57:      dash_S, dash_extra, dash_run, dash_s].
   58: 
   59: groups() -> 
   60:     [{boot, [], [boot1, boot2]}].
   61: 
   62: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   63:     Config.
   64: 
   65: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   66:     ok.
   67: 
   68: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   69:     Config.
   70: 
   71: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   72:     Config.
   73: 
   74: 
   75: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   76:     Config.
   77: 
   78: end_per_testcase(_Func, _Config) ->
   79:     ok.
   80: 
   81: get_arguments(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   82:     Args = args(),
   83:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
   84:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_arguments, []) of
   85: 	Arguments when is_list(Arguments) ->
   86: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
   87: 	    check_a(Arguments),
   88: 	    check_b(Arguments),
   89: 	    check_c(Arguments),
   90: 	    check_d(Arguments);
   91: 	_ ->
   92:             peer:stop(Peer),
   93: 	    ct:fail(get_arguments)
   94:     end,
   95:     ok.
   96: 
   97: check_a(Args) ->
   98:     case lists:keysearch(a,1,Args) of
   99: 	{value, {a,["kalle"]}} ->
  100: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(a,1,Args),
  101: 	    case lists:keysearch(a,1,Args1) of
  102: 		false ->
  103: 		    ok;
  104: 		_ ->
  105: 		    ct:fail(check_a1)
  106: 	    end;
  107: 	_ ->
  108: 	    ct:fail(check_a2)
  109:     end.
  110: 
  111: check_b(Args) ->
  112:     case lists:keysearch(b,1,Args) of
  113: 	{value, {b,["hej", "hopp"]}} ->
  114: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(b,1,Args),
  115: 	    case lists:keysearch(b,1,Args1) of
  116: 		{value, {b,["san", "sa"]}} ->
  117: 		    Args2 = lists:keydelete(b,1,Args1),
  118: 		    case lists:keysearch(b,1,Args2) of
  119: 			false ->
  120: 			    ok;
  121: 			_ ->
  122: 			    ct:fail(check_b1)
  123: 		    end;
  124: 		_ ->
  125: 		    ct:fail(check_b2)
  126: 	    end;
  127: 	_ ->
  128: 	    ct:fail(check_b3)
  129:     end.
  130: 
  131: check_c(Args) ->
  132:     case lists:keysearch(c,1,Args) of
  133: 	{value, {c,["4", "5", "6"]}} ->
  134: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(c,1,Args),
  135: 	    case lists:keysearch(c,1,Args1) of
  136: 		{value, {c,["7", "8", "9"]}} ->
  137: 		    Args2 = lists:keydelete(c,1,Args1),
  138: 		    case lists:keysearch(c,1,Args2) of
  139: 			false ->
  140: 			    ok;
  141: 			_ ->
  142: 			    ct:fail(check_c1)
  143: 		    end;
  144: 		_ ->
  145: 		    ct:fail(check_c2)
  146: 	    end;
  147: 	_ ->
  148: 	    ct:fail(check_c3)
  149:     end.
  150: 
  151: check_d(Args) ->
  152:     case lists:keysearch(d,1,Args) of
  153: 	{value, {d,[]}} ->
  154: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(d,1,Args),
  155: 	    case lists:keysearch(d,1,Args1) of
  156: 		false ->
  157: 		    ok;
  158: 		_ ->
  159: 		    ct:fail(check_d1)
  160: 	    end;
  161: 	_ ->
  162: 	    ct:fail(check_d2)
  163:     end.
  164: 
  165: get_argument(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  166:     Args = args(),
  167:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  168:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [b]) of
  169: 	{ok, [["hej", "hopp"],["san", "sa"]]} ->
  170: 	    ok;
  171: 	_ ->
  172: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  173: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, b})
  174:     end,
  175:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [a]) of
  176: 	{ok, [["kalle"]]} ->
  177: 	    ok;
  178: 	_ ->
  179: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  180: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, a})
  181:     end,
  182:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [c]) of
  183: 	{ok, [["4", "5", "6"], ["7", "8", "9"]]} ->
  184: 	    ok;
  185: 	_ ->
  186: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  187: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, c})
  188:     end,
  189:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [d]) of
  190: 	{ok, [[]]} ->
  191: 	    ok;
  192: 	_ ->
  193: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  194: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, d})
  195:     end,
  196:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [e]) of
  197: 	error ->
  198: 	    ok;
  199: 	_ ->
  200: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  201: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, e})
  202:     end,
  203:     peer:stop(Peer),
  204:     ok.
  205: 
  206: get_plain_arguments(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  207:     Longstring = 
  208: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  209: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  210: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  211: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  212: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  213: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  214: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  215: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  216: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2",
  217:     true = (length(Longstring) > 255),
  218:     Args = long_args(Longstring),
  219:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  220:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_plain_arguments, []) of
  221: 	["a", "b", "c", Longstring] ->
  222: 	    ok;
  223: 	As ->
  224: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  225: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, As})
  226:     end,
  227:     peer:stop(Peer),
  228: 
  229:     ok.
  230: 
  231: 
  232: %% ------------------------------------------------
  233: %% Use -boot_var flag to set $TEST_VAR in boot script.
  234: %% ------------------------------------------------
  235: boot_var(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  236:     {BootScript, TEST_VAR, KernelVsn, StdlibVsn} = create_boot(Config),
  237: 
  238:     %% Should fail as we have not given -boot_var TEST_VAR
  239:     try
  240:         ?CT_PEER(#{args => ["-boot", BootScript], connection => standard_io}),
  241:         ct:fail({boot_var, "Should not start without TEST_VAR"})
  242:     catch
  243:         exit:{boot_failed,{exit_status,1}} ->
  244:             ok
  245:     end,
  246: 
  247: 
  248:     case is_real_system(KernelVsn, StdlibVsn) of
  249: 	true ->
  250: 	    %% Now it should work !!
  251: 	    {ok, Peer, _} = ?CT_PEER(["-boot", BootScript, "-boot_var", "TEST_VAR", TEST_VAR]),
  252: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  253: 	    Res = ok;
  254: 	_ ->
  255: 	    %% What we need is not so much version numbers on the directories, but
  256: 	    %% for the boot var TEST_VAR to appear in the boot script, and it doesn't
  257: 	    %% if we give the 'local' option to systools:make_script.
  258: 	    io:format(
  259: 	      "Test case not complete as we are not~n"
  260: 	      "running in a real system!~n"
  261: 	      "Probably this test is performed in a "
  262: 	      "clearcase view or source tree.~n"
  263: 	      "Need version numbers on the kernel and "
  264: 	      "stdlib directories!~n",
  265: 	      []),
  266: 	    Res = {skip,
  267: 		   "Test case only partially run since it is run "
  268: 		   "in a clearcase view or in a source tree. "
  269: 		   "Need an installed system to complete this test."}
  270:     end,
  271:     Res.
  272: 
  273: create_boot(Config) ->
  274:     {ok, OldDir} = file:get_cwd(),
  275:     {LatestDir, LatestName, KernelVsn, StdlibVsn} =
  276: 	create_script(Config),
  277:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  278:     ok = file:set_cwd(LatestDir),
  279:     ok = systools:make_script(LatestName,
  280: 			      [{variables, [{"TEST_VAR", LibDir}]}]),
  281:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldDir),
  282:     {LatestDir ++ "/" ++ LatestName, LibDir, KernelVsn, StdlibVsn}.
  283: 
  284: is_real_system(KernelVsn, StdlibVsn) ->
  285:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  286:     filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir, "kernel-"++KernelVsn)) andalso
  287: 	filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir, "stdlib-"++StdlibVsn)).
  288: 
  289: %% ------------------------------------------------
  290: %% Slave executes erlang:halt() on master nodedown.
  291: %% Therefore the slave process must be killed
  292: %% before restart.
  293: %% ------------------------------------------------
  294: many_restarts() ->
  295:     [{timetrap,{minutes,16}}].
  296: 
  297: many_restarts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  298:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => standard_io}),
  299:     loop_restart(50,Peer,Node,rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[logger])),
  300:     peer:stop(Peer),
  301:     ok.
  302: 
  303: loop_restart(0,_,_,_) ->
  304:     ok;
  305: loop_restart(N,Peer,Node,EHPid) ->
  306:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  307:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, restart, []),
  308:     receive
  309: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  310: 	    ok
  311:     after 10000 ->
  312: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  313: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  314:     end,
  315:     ok = wait_for(60, Peer, Node, EHPid),
  316:     loop_restart(N-1,Peer,Node,rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[logger])).
  317: 
  318: wait_for(0,Peer,_Node,_) ->
  319:     peer:stop(Peer),
  320:     error;
  321: wait_for(N,Peer,Node,EHPid) ->
  322:     case rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [logger]) of
  323: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid), Pid =/= EHPid ->
  324: 	    %% erlang:display(ok),
  325: 	    ok;
  326: 	_X ->
  327: 	    %% erlang:display(_X),
  328: 	    %% Procs = rpc:call(Node, erlang, processes, []),
  329: 	    %% erlang:display(Procs),
  330: 	    %% case is_list(Procs) of
  331: 	    %%     true ->
  332: 	    %% 	  [(catch erlang:display(
  333: 	    %% 			  rpc:call(Node,
  334: 	    %% 				   erlang,
  335: 	    %% 				   process_info,
  336: 	    %% 				   [Y,registered_name])))
  337: 	    %% 		 || Y <- Procs];
  338: 	    %%     _ ->
  339: 	    %% 	  ok
  340: 	    %% end,
  341: 	    receive
  342: 	    after 100 ->
  343: 		    ok
  344: 	    end,
  345: 	    wait_for(N-1,Peer,Node,EHPid)
  346:     end.
  347: 
  348: restart_with_mode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  349:     %% We cannot use loose_node because it doesn't run in
  350:     %% embedded mode so we quickly start one that exits after restarting
  351:     {ok,[[Erl]]} = init:get_argument(progname),
  352: 
  353:     Quote = case os:type() of
  354:                 {win32,_} ->
  355:                     [$"];
  356:                 {unix,_} ->
  357:                     [$']
  358:             end,
  359: 
  360:     Eval1 = Quote ++ "Mode=code:get_mode(), io:fwrite(Mode), case Mode of interactive -> init:restart([{mode,embedded}]); embedded -> erlang:halt() end" ++ Quote,
  361:     Cmd1 = Erl ++ " -mode interactive -noshell -eval " ++ Eval1,
  362:     "interactiveembedded" = os:cmd(Cmd1),
  363: 
  364:     Eval2 = Quote ++ "Mode=code:get_mode(), io:fwrite(Mode), case Mode of embedded -> init:restart([{mode,interactive}]); interactive -> erlang:halt() end" ++ Quote,
  365:     Cmd2 = Erl ++ " -mode embedded -noshell -eval " ++ Eval2,
  366:     "embeddedinteractive" = os:cmd(Cmd2),
  367: 
  368:     ok.
  369: 
  370: %% ------------------------------------------------
  371: %% Slave executes erlang:halt() on master nodedown.
  372: %% Therefore the slave process must be killed
  373: %% before restart.
  374: %% ------------------------------------------------
  375: restart(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  376:     Args = args(),
  377:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{args => Args, connection => standard_io}),
  378:     %% Ok, the node is up, now the real test test begins.
  379:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  380:     SysProcs0 = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, find_system_processes, []),
  381:     io:format("SysProcs0=~p~n", [SysProcs0]),
  382:     [InitPid, PurgerPid, LitCollectorPid,
  383:      DirtySigNPid, DirtySigHPid, DirtySigMPid,
  384:      PrimFilePid,
  385:      ESockRegPid] = SysProcs0,
  386:     InitPid = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [init]),
  387:     PurgerPid = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [erts_code_purger]),
  388:     Procs = rpc:call(Node, erlang, processes, []),
  389:     MsgFlags = fetch_socket_msg_flags(Node),
  390:     MaxPid = lists:last(Procs),
  391:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, restart, []),
  392:     receive
  393: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  394: 	    ok
  395:     after 10000 ->
  396: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  397: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  398:     end,
  399:     ok = wait_restart(30, Node),
  400: 
  401:     SysProcs1 = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, find_system_processes, []),
  402:     io:format("SysProcs1=~p~n", [SysProcs1]),
  403:     [InitPid1, PurgerPid1, LitCollectorPid1,
  404:      DirtySigNPid1, DirtySigHPid1, DirtySigMPid1,
  405:      PrimFilePid1,
  406:      ESockRegPid1] = SysProcs1,
  407: 
  408:     %% Still the same init process!
  409:     InitPid1 = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [init]),
  410:     InitP = pid_to_list(InitPid),
  411:     InitP = pid_to_list(InitPid1),
  412: 
  413:     %% and same purger process!
  414:     PurgerPid1 = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [erts_code_purger]),
  415:     PurgerP = pid_to_list(PurgerPid),
  416:     PurgerP = pid_to_list(PurgerPid1),
  417: 
  418:     %% and same literal area collector process!
  419:     LitCollectorP = pid_to_list(LitCollectorPid),
  420:     LitCollectorP = pid_to_list(LitCollectorPid1),
  421: 
  422:     %% and same normal dirty signal handler process!
  423:     DirtySigNP = pid_to_list(DirtySigNPid),
  424:     DirtySigNP = pid_to_list(DirtySigNPid1),
  425:     %% and same high dirty signal handler process!
  426:     DirtySigHP = pid_to_list(DirtySigHPid),
  427:     DirtySigHP = pid_to_list(DirtySigHPid1),
  428:     %% and same max dirty signal handler process!
  429:     DirtySigMP = pid_to_list(DirtySigMPid),
  430:     DirtySigMP = pid_to_list(DirtySigMPid1),
  431: 
  432:     %% and same prim_file helper process!
  433:     PrimFileP = pid_to_list(PrimFilePid),
  434:     PrimFileP = pid_to_list(PrimFilePid1),
  435: 
  436:     %% and same socket_registry helper process!
  437:     if ESockRegPid =:= undefined, ESockRegPid1 =:= undefined ->
  438:             %% No socket registry on either node
  439:             ok;
  440:        true ->
  441:             ESockRegP = pid_to_list(ESockRegPid),
  442:             ESockRegP = pid_to_list(ESockRegPid1)
  443:     end,
  444: 
  445:     NewProcs0 = rpc:call(Node, erlang, processes, []),
  446:     NewProcs = NewProcs0 -- SysProcs1,
  447:     case check_processes(NewProcs, MaxPid) of
  448: 	true ->
  449: 	    ok;
  450: 	_ ->
  451: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  452: 	    ct:fail(processes_not_greater)
  453:     end,
  454: 
  455:     %% Check that socket tables has been re-initialized; check one
  456:     MsgFlags = fetch_socket_msg_flags(Node),
  457: 
  458:     %% Test that, for instance, the same argument still exists.
  459:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [c]) of
  460: 	{ok, [["4", "5", "6"], ["7", "8", "9"]]} ->
  461: 	    ok;
  462: 	_ ->
  463: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  464: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, restart_fail})
  465:     end,
  466:     peer:stop(Peer),
  467:     ok.
  468: 
  469: -record(sys_procs, {init,
  470: 		    code_purger,
  471: 		    literal_collector,
  472: 		    dirty_sig_handler_normal,
  473: 		    dirty_sig_handler_high,
  474: 		    dirty_sig_handler_max,
  475:                     prim_file,
  476:                     socket_registry}).
  477: 
  478: find_system_processes() ->
  479:     find_system_procs(processes(), #sys_procs{}).
  480: 
  481: find_system_procs([], SysProcs) ->
  482:     [SysProcs#sys_procs.init,
  483:      SysProcs#sys_procs.code_purger,
  484:      SysProcs#sys_procs.literal_collector,
  485:      SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_normal,
  486:      SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_high,
  487:      SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_max,
  488:      SysProcs#sys_procs.prim_file,
  489:      SysProcs#sys_procs.socket_registry];
  490: find_system_procs([P|Ps], SysProcs) ->
  491:     case process_info(P, [initial_call, priority]) of
  492: 	[{initial_call,{erl_init,start,2}},_] ->
  493: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.init,
  494: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{init = P});
  495: 	[{initial_call,{erts_code_purger,start,0}},_] ->
  496: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.code_purger,
  497: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{code_purger = P});
  498: 	[{initial_call,{erts_literal_area_collector,start,0}},_] ->
  499: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.literal_collector,
  500: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{literal_collector = P});
  501: 	[{initial_call,{erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}},
  502:          {priority,normal}] ->
  503: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_normal,
  504: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{dirty_sig_handler_normal = P});
  505: 	[{initial_call,{erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}},
  506:                        {priority,high}] ->
  507: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_high,
  508: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{dirty_sig_handler_high = P});
  509: 	[{initial_call,{erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}},
  510:          {priority,max}] ->
  511: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_max,
  512: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{dirty_sig_handler_max = P});
  513:         [{initial_call,{prim_file,start,0}},_] ->
  514: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.prim_file,
  515: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{prim_file = P});
  516:         [{initial_call,{socket_registry,start,0}},_] ->
  517: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.socket_registry,
  518: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{socket_registry = P});
  519: 	_ ->
  520: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs)
  521:     end.
  522: 
  523: wait_restart(0, _Node) ->
  524:     ct:fail(not_restarted);
  525: wait_restart(N, Node) ->
  526:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  527: 	pong -> ok;
  528: 	_ -> 
  529: 	    ct:sleep(1000),
  530: 	    wait_restart(N - 1, Node)
  531:     end.
  532: 
  533: check_processes(NewProcs, MaxPid) ->
  534:     [N,P,I] = apid(MaxPid),
  535:     case lists:filter(fun(Pid) ->
  536: 			      case apid(Pid) of
  537: 				  [N,P1,_I1] when P1 > P -> false;
  538: 				  [N,_P1,I1] when I1 > I -> false;
  539: 				  _                      -> true
  540: 			      end
  541: 		      end, NewProcs) of
  542: 	[] ->
  543: 	    true;
  544: 	_  ->
  545: 	    false
  546:     end.
  547: 
  548: apid(Pid) ->
  549:     [N,P,I] = string:tokens(pid_to_list(Pid),"<>."),
  550:     [list_to_integer(N),list_to_integer(P),list_to_integer(I)].
  551: 
  552: fetch_socket_msg_flags(Node) ->
  553:     case code:is_loaded(prim_socket) of
  554:         {file,preloaded} ->
  555:             lists:sort(rpc:call(Node, socket, supports, [msg_flags]));
  556:         _ ->
  557:             ok
  558:     end.
  559: 
  560: %% ------------------------------------------------
  561: %% Just test that the system is halted here.
  562: %% The reboot facility using heart is tested
  563: %% in the heart_SUITE.
  564: %% ------------------------------------------------
  565: reboot(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  566:     Args = args(),
  567:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  568:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  569:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, reboot, []),
  570:     receive
  571: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  572: 	    ok
  573:     after 10000 ->
  574: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  575: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  576:     end,
  577:     ct:sleep(5000),
  578:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  579: 	pang ->
  580: 	    ok;
  581: 	_ ->
  582: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  583: 	    ct:fail(system_rebooted)
  584:     end,
  585:     ok.
  586: 
  587: %% ------------------------------------------------
  588: %%
  589: %% ------------------------------------------------
  590: stop_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  591:     badarg = catch_stop([65,[66],67]),  % flat strings only
  592:     badarg = catch_stop([65, 666, 67]),  % only bytes in string
  593:     badarg = catch_stop(abort),  % 'abort' not allowed
  594:     badarg = catch_stop(true),  % other atoms not allowed
  595:     badarg = catch_stop(-1),  % no negative statuses
  596:     ok.
  597: 
  598: catch_stop(Status) ->
  599:     try init:stop(Status) catch error:badarg -> badarg end.
  600: 
  601: %% ------------------------------------------------
  602: %%
  603: %% ------------------------------------------------
  604: stop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  605:     Args = args(),
  606:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  607:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  608:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, reboot, []),
  609:     receive
  610: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  611: 	    ok
  612:     after 10000 ->
  613: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  614: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  615:     end,
  616:     ct:sleep(5000),
  617:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  618: 	pang ->
  619: 	    ok;
  620: 	_ ->
  621: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  622: 	    ct:fail(system_rebooted)
  623:     end,
  624:     ok.
  625: 
  626: %% ------------------------------------------------
  627: %% 
  628: %% ------------------------------------------------
  629: get_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  630:     {Start, _} = init:get_status(),
  631: 
  632:     %% Depending on how the test_server is started Start has
  633:     %% different values. staring if test_server started with
  634:     %% -s flag.
  635:     case lists:member(Start, [started, starting]) of
  636: 	true ->
  637: 	    ok;
  638: 	_ ->
  639: 	    ct:fail(get_status)
  640:     end.
  641: 
  642: %% ------------------------------------------------
  643: %% 
  644: %% ------------------------------------------------
  645: script_id(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  646:     {Name, Vsn} = init:script_id(),
  647:     if
  648: 	is_list(Name), is_list(Vsn) ->
  649: 	    ok;
  650: 	true ->
  651: 	    ct:fail(not_standard_script)
  652:     end,
  653:     ok.
  654: 
  655: %% ------------------------------------------------
  656: %% Test that .erlang file works as it should
  657: %% ------------------------------------------------
  658: dot_erlang(Config) ->
  659:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  660: 
  661:     TestHome = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  662:     ok = file:make_dir(TestHome),
  663: 
  664:     HomeEnv = case os:type() of
  665:                   {win32, _} ->
  666:                       [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
  667:                       [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome,"AppData")},
  668:                        {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive}, {"HOMEPATH", filename:join(Path)}];
  669:                   _ ->
  670:                       [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  671:               end,
  672: 
  673:     NodeOpts = #{ env => HomeEnv },
  674: 
  675:     %% Get basedir of peer node
  676:     {ok, CreatorPeer, CreatorNode} = ?CT_PEER(NodeOpts),
  677:     UserConfig = erpc:call(CreatorNode, filename, basedir, [user_config,"erlang"]),
  678:     peer:stop(CreatorPeer),
  679: 
  680:     XDGErlang = filename:join([UserConfig, ".erlang"]),
  681:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(XDGErlang),
  682:     ok = file:write_file(XDGErlang, "application:set_env(kernel,test,xdg)."),
  683: 
  684:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(NodeOpts),
  685: 
  686:     ?assertEqual({ok, xdg}, erpc:call(Node, application, get_env, [kernel, test])),
  687:     peer:stop(Peer),
  688: 
  689:     HomeErlang = filename:join([TestHome, ".erlang"]),
  690:     ok = file:write_file(HomeErlang, "application:set_env(kernel,test,home)."),
  691:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(NodeOpts),
  692: 
  693:     ?assertEqual({ok, home}, erpc:call(Node2, application, get_env, [kernel, test])),
  694:     peer:stop(Peer2),
  695: 
  696:     ok.
  697: 
  698: unknown_module(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  699:     Port = open_port({spawn, "erl -s unknown_module"},
  700:                      [exit_status, use_stdio, stderr_to_stdout]),
  701:     Error = "Error! Failed to load module 'unknown_module' because it cannot be found.",
  702:     [_ | _] = string:find(collect_until_exit_one(Port), Error),
  703:     ok.
  704: 
  705: collect_until_exit_one(Port) ->
  706:     receive
  707:         {Port, {data, Msg}} -> Msg ++ collect_until_exit_one(Port);
  708:         {Port, {exit_status, 1}} -> []
  709:     after
  710:         30_000 -> ct:fail(erl_timeout)
  711:     end.
  712: 
  713: %% ------------------------------------------------
  714: %% Start the slave system with -boot flag.
  715: %% ------------------------------------------------
  716: 
  717: boot1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  718:     Args = args() ++ ["-boot", "start_sasl"],
  719:     {ok, Peer, _Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  720:     peer:stop(Peer),
  721: 
  722:     %% Try to start with non existing boot file.
  723:     Args1 = args() ++ ["-boot", "dummy_script"],
  724:     try
  725:         ?CT_PEER(#{args => Args1, connection => standard_io}),
  726:         ct:fail({boot1, "started with non existing boot file"})
  727:     catch
  728:         exit:{boot_failed, {exit_status, 1}} ->
  729:             ok
  730:     end.
  731: 
  732: boot2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  733:     %% Absolute boot file name
  734:     Boot = filename:join([code:root_dir(), "bin", "start_sasl"]),
  735: 
  736:     Args = args() ++ ["-boot", Boot],
  737:     {ok, Peer, _Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  738:     peer:stop(Peer),
  739: 
  740:     case os:type() of 
  741: 	{win32, _} ->
  742: 	    %% Absolute boot file name for Windows -- all slashes are
  743: 	    %% converted to backslashes.
  744: 	    Win_boot = lists:map(fun
  745: 				     ($/) -> $\\;
  746: 				     (C) -> C
  747: 				end, Boot),
  748: 	    Args2 = args() ++ ["-boot", Win_boot],
  749: 	    {ok, Peer2, _Node2} = ?CT_PEER(Args2),
  750: 	    peer:stop(Peer2);
  751: 	_ ->
  752: 	    ok
  753:     end,
  754: 
  755:     ok.
  756: 
  757: dash_S(_Config) ->
  758: 
  759:     %% Test that arguments are passed correctly
  760:     {[],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test([]),
  761:     {["a"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["a"]),
  762:     {["-S","--"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["-S","--"]),
  763:     {["--help"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["--help"]),
  764:     {["-extra"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["-extra"]),
  765:     {["-run"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["-run"]),
  766:     {["-args_file"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["-args_file"]),
  767:     {["+A","-1"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["+A","-1"]),
  768:     {["-s","init","stop"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["-s","init","stop"]),
  769: 
  770:     %% Test that environment variables are handled correctly
  771:     {["a"],["b","c","d"],[]} =
  772:         run_dash_S_test([{"ERL_AFLAGS","b"},{"ERL_FLAGS","c"},{"ERL_ZFLAGS","d"}],["a"]),
  773:     %% test that -S in environment variables are interpreted as flags
  774:     {["a"],[],[["a"],["b"],["c"]]} =
  775:         run_dash_S_test([{"ERL_AFLAGS","+S 1 -S a"},{"ERL_FLAGS","-S b"},
  776:                          {"ERL_ZFLAGS","-S c"}],["a"]),
  777: 
  778:     %% Test that -s and -run work
  779:     ?assertMatch(
  780:        "[a].{[\"a\""++_,
  781:        run_dash_test(["-s",?MODULE,"test_dash_s","a","-S",?MODULE,"test_dash_S","a"])),
  782:     ?assertMatch(
  783:        "[\"a\"].{[\"a\""++_,
  784:        run_dash_test(["-run",?MODULE,"test_dash_s","a","-S",?MODULE,"test_dash_S","a"])),
  785: 
  786:     %% Test error conditions
  787:     ?assertNotEqual(
  788:        nomatch,
  789:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-S"]),
  790:                    "Error! The -S option must be followed by at least a module to start")),
  791: 
  792:     ?assertNotEqual(
  793:        nomatch,
  794:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-S","a"]),
  795:                    "Error! Failed to load module 'a' because it cannot be found.")),
  796: 
  797:     ?assertNotEqual(
  798:        nomatch,
  799:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-S",?MODULE,"a"]),
  800:                    "Error! init_SUITE:a/1 is not exported.")),
  801: 
  802:     ok.
  803: 
  804: run_dash_S_test(Args) ->
  805:     run_dash_S_test("", Args).
  806: run_dash_S_test(Prefix, Args) ->
  807:     run_dash_test(Prefix, ["-S", ?MODULE, "test_dash_S" | Args]).
  808: 
  809: test_dash_S(Args) ->
  810:     AllArgs = {Args, init:get_plain_arguments(),
  811:                proplists:get_all_values('S',init:get_arguments()),
  812:                erlang:system_info(emu_args)},
  813:     io:format("~p.",[AllArgs]),
  814:     erlang:halt().
  815: 
  816: test_dash_s(Args) ->
  817:     io:format("~p.",[Args]).
  818: 
  819: dash_run(_Config) ->
  820: 
  821:     {undefined,[]} =
  822:         run_dash_test(["-run",?MODULE,"test_dash_run","-s","init","stop"]),
  823: 
  824:     {["a"],["b"]} =
  825:         run_dash_test(["-run",?MODULE,"test_dash_run","a","--","b","-s","init","stop"]),
  826: 
  827:     %% Test error conditions
  828:     ?assertNotEqual(
  829:        nomatch,
  830:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-run","a"]),
  831:                    "Error! Failed to load module 'a' because it cannot be found.")),
  832: 
  833:     ?assertNotEqual(
  834:        nomatch,
  835:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-run",?MODULE]),
  836:                    "Error! init_SUITE:start/0 is not exported.")),
  837: 
  838:     ?assertNotEqual(
  839:        nomatch,
  840:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-run",?MODULE,"a"]),
  841:                    "Error! init_SUITE:a/0 is not exported.")),
  842: 
  843:     ok.
  844: 
  845: test_dash_run() ->
  846:     test_dash_run(undefined).
  847: test_dash_run(Args) ->
  848:     io:format("~p.",[{Args, init:get_plain_arguments(), erlang:system_info(emu_args)}]),
  849:     ok.
  850: 
  851: dash_s(_Config) ->
  852: 
  853:     {undefined,[]} =
  854:         run_dash_test(["-s",?MODULE,"test_dash_run","-s","init","stop"]),
  855: 
  856:     {[a],["b"]} =
  857:         run_dash_test(["-s",?MODULE,"test_dash_run","a","--","b","-s","init","stop"]),
  858: 
  859:     %% Test error conditions
  860:     ?assertNotEqual(
  861:        nomatch,
  862:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-s","a"]),
  863:                    "Error! Failed to load module 'a' because it cannot be found.")),
  864: 
  865:     ?assertNotEqual(
  866:        nomatch,
  867:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-s",?MODULE]),
  868:                    "Error! init_SUITE:start/0 is not exported.")),
  869: 
  870:     ?assertNotEqual(
  871:        nomatch,
  872:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-s",?MODULE,"a"]),
  873:                    "Error! init_SUITE:a/0 is not exported.")),
  874: 
  875:     ok.
  876: 
  877: dash_extra(Config) ->
  878:     %% Test that arguments are passed correctly
  879:     {[]} = run_dash_extra_test([]),
  880:     {["a"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["a"]),
  881:     {["--help"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["--help"]),
  882:     {["-S","--"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["-S","--"]),
  883:     {["-extra","--"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["-extra","--"]),
  884:     {["-run"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["-run"]),
  885:     {["-args_file"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["-args_file"]),
  886:     {["+A","-1"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["+A","-1"]),
  887:     {["-s","init","stop"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["-s","init","stop"]),
  888: 
  889:     %% Test that environment variables are handled correctly
  890:     {["b","c","d","a"]} =
  891:         run_dash_extra_test([{"ERL_AFLAGS","b"},{"ERL_FLAGS","c"},{"ERL_ZFLAGS","d"}],
  892:                             ["a"]),
  893:     {["c","d","+A","1","--","a"]} =
  894:         run_dash_extra_test([{"ERL_AFLAGS","-extra +A 1 --"},{"ERL_FLAGS","c"},{"ERL_ZFLAGS","d"}],
  895:                             ["a"]),
  896:     {["+A","a","+B","+C"]} =
  897:         run_dash_extra_test([{"ERL_AFLAGS","-extra +A"},
  898:                              {"ERL_FLAGS","-extra +B"},
  899:                              {"ERL_ZFLAGS","-extra +C"}],["a"]),
  900: 
  901:     %% Test that arguments from -args_file work as they should
  902:     ArgsFile = filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config),
  903:                              atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_args_file.args"),
  904:     NestedArgsFile = filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config),
  905:                              atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_nexted_args_file.args"),
  906:     file:write_file(NestedArgsFile,"y -extra +Y"),
  907: 
  908:     file:write_file(ArgsFile,["z -args_file ",NestedArgsFile," -extra +Z"]),
  909: 
  910:     {["c","z","y","d",
  911:       %% -extra starts here
  912:       "a","+Y","+Z","b"]} =
  913:         run_dash_extra_test([{"ERL_FLAGS",["c -args_file ",ArgsFile," d -extra b"]}],["a"]),
  914: 
  915:     ok.
  916: 
  917: run_dash_extra_test(Args) ->
  918:     run_dash_extra_test([], Args).
  919: run_dash_extra_test(Prefix, Args) ->
  920:     run_dash_test(Prefix, ["-run", ?MODULE, "test_dash_extra", "-extra" | Args]).
  921: 
  922: test_dash_extra() ->
  923:     AllArgs = {init:get_plain_arguments(), erlang:system_info(emu_args)},
  924:     io:format("~p.",[AllArgs]),
  925:     erlang:halt().
  926: 
  927: 
  928: run_dash_test(Args) ->
  929:     run_dash_test([],Args).
  930: run_dash_test(Env, Args) ->
  931:     [Exec | ExecArgs] = string:split(ct:get_progname()," ", all),
  932:     PortExec = os:find_executable(Exec),
  933:     PortArgs = ExecArgs ++ ["-pa",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  934:                             "-noshell" | Args],
  935:     PortEnv = [{"ERL_CRASH_DUMP_SECONDS","0"} |
  936:                [{K,lists:flatten(V)} || {K, V} <- Env]],
  937:     ct:log("Exec: ~p~nPortArgs: ~p~nPortEnv: ~p~n",[PortExec, PortArgs, PortEnv]),
  938:     Port =
  939:         open_port({spawn_executable, PortExec},
  940:                   [stderr_to_stdout,binary,out,in,hide,exit_status,
  941:                    {args, PortArgs}, {env, PortEnv}]),
  942:     receive
  943:         {Port,{exit_status,N}} ->
  944:             N
  945:     after 5000 ->
  946:             ct:fail({timeout, receive M -> M after 0 -> [] end})
  947:     end,
  948:     Res = unicode:characters_to_list(
  949:             iolist_to_binary(
  950:               (fun F() ->
  951:                        receive
  952:                            {Port,{data,Data}} ->
  953:                                [Data | F()]
  954:                        after 0 ->
  955:                                []
  956:                        end
  957:                end)())),
  958:     ct:log("Res: ~ts~n",[Res]),
  959:     maybe
  960:         {ok, Toks, _} ?= erl_scan:string(Res),
  961:         {ok, Tuple} ?= erl_parse:parse_term(Toks),
  962:         erlang:delete_element(tuple_size(Tuple), Tuple)
  963:     else
  964:         _ ->
  965:             Res
  966:     end.
  967: 
  968: %% Misc. functions    
  969: 
  970: args() ->
  971:     ["-a", "kalle", "--", "a", "b", "-d", "-b", "hej", "hopp",
  972:         "--", "c", "d", "-b", "san", "sa", "-c", "4", "5", "6", "-c", "7", "8", "9"].
  973: 
  974: long_args(A) ->
  975:     ["-a", "kalle", "--", "a", "b", "-d", "-b", "hej", "hopp", "--", "c", A,
  976:         "-b", "san", "sa", "-c", "4", "5", "6", "-c", "7", "8", "9"].
  977: 
  978: create_script(Config) ->
  979:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  980:     Name = PrivDir ++ "boot_var_test",
  981:     Apps = application_controller:which_applications(),
  982:     {value,{_,_,KernelVer}} = lists:keysearch(kernel,1,Apps),
  983:     {value,{_,_,StdlibVer}} = lists:keysearch(stdlib,1,Apps),
  984:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
  985:     io:format(Fd,
  986: 	      "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"P2A\"}, \n"
  987: 	      " {erts, \"4.4\"}, \n"
  988: 	      " [{kernel, \"~s\"}, {stdlib, \"~s\"}]}.\n",
  989: 	      [KernelVer,StdlibVer]),
  990:     file:close(Fd),
  991:     {filename:dirname(Name), filename:basename(Name),
  992:      KernelVer, StdlibVer}.
  993:
